description: This course surveys the influential philosophical traditions of India and China. Students explore the major traditions including Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, Confucianism, and Taoism and consider other traditions with which they have interacted. Where appropriate, comparisons are drawn to Western philosophical traditions. Offered annually. Prerequisite: One course in Philosophy or permission of instructor.
name: Asian Philosophy
prerequisites: One course in Philosophy or permission of instructor.
